title: Pounding
data:
[![](/images/thumb/e/e9/Pounding_Diagram.png/300px-Pounding_Diagram.png)](/wiki/File:Pounding_Diagram.png)



Players can pound colored squares, depending on their [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") level.

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **pounding** is the action of [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") or [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") on a target that is at a distance of two [squares](/wiki/Square "Square") from the wielder.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)

- [5 References](#References)

## Description

Pounding with a weapon allows a character or monster to attack a target that is not adjacent and is roughly two squares away from them, with the eligible target squares dependent on the wielder's skill in that weapon:

ESUSE  
SXXXS  
UX\@XU  
SXXXS  
ESUSE

The @ is the wielder's location. Spaces marked with a X are too close to be hit, spaces marked with a U can be hit even while Unskilled, spaces marked with a S can only be hit when Skilled, and spaces marked with a E can only be hit when Expert. Only [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") can reach Expert skill level in lance, and no roles can reach more than Skilled in polearms.

Pounding will not trigger [passive attacks](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") from monsters against the wielder, but does scuff engravings on their square and cause [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") to fade, incurring an [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") penalty;[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) the pounding weapon will still be subject to the effects of passive attacks (e.g. [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion"), [disenchantment](/wiki/Disenchantment "Disenchantment"), etc.) as normal. When [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), the range for pounding is the lesser of your pounding weapon's skill and your two-weapon combat skill - this is only applicable with a lance, as all polearms are two-handed. A lance can be used for pounding without any penalty, even when the wielder is not mounted.\[*citation needed*]

Most monsters can only pound using polearms and lances with a skill level equivalent of Unskilled - [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") are an exception, and can pound with a skill level equivalent of Skilled.

## Strategy

A character with fast [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") or better that is pounding at Skilled level or better can take out groups of hostile monsters using a choke point (such as a door) that is a knight's move away. Characters planning to pound monsters in corridors will need either a [light source](/wiki/Light_source "Light source") or [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), since pounding cannot target unseen monsters even if they can be detected via other means.

Pounding can deal well with monsters that are deadly in melee range: aside from passive attacks, [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") on levels such as [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island"), the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") and the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower") are prime pounding targets to avoid their [drowning attacks](/wiki/Drowning_attack "Drowning attack"). Pounding can also be used for the [hit and run](/wiki/Hit_and_run "Hit and run") tactic, and is much safer than melee attacks in that respect.

## History

The game function is first named by Shawn M. Moore, whose [*Knight FAQ*](https://sartak.org/nh/knight-faq-343.html#poleweapons) for [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") gives a thorough description of the mechanic.

The feature of pounding scuffing engravings on the square beneath the pounder is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the range for pounding with a lance or polearm is expanded and made unrestricted by skill level:

UUUUU  
UXXXU  
UX\@XU  
UXXXU  
UUUUU

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") allow the use of other weapons besides polearms and lances to pound.

The [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys"), [white vibrospear](/index.php?title=White_vibrospear\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White vibrospear (page does not exist)"), [gold-bladed vibrospear](/index.php?title=Gold-bladed_vibrospear\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gold-bladed vibrospear (page does not exist)"), and [force pike](/index.php?title=Force_pike\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Force pike (page does not exist)") can be applied to pound as a polearm; the [shepherd's crook](/index.php?title=Shepherd%27s_crook\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shepherd's crook (page does not exist)") is a weapon that can be applied to pound like a polearm, but is also able to pick up items and pull monsters on those squares. [Sol Valtiva](/wiki/Sol_Valtiva_\(dNetHack\) "Sol Valtiva (dNetHack)") and [Shadowlock](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Shadowlock "DNetHack artifacts") are artifacts that can also be applied to pound as a polearm, and [The Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/The_Rod_of_Lordly_Might "The Rod of Lordly Might"), [The Rod of the Elvish Lords](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Rod_of_the_Elvish_Lords "DNetHack artifacts") and [The Sceptre of Lolth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Sceptre_of_Lolth "DNetHack artifacts") can be applied to pound while in lance form.

A weapon's pounding range is determined by that weapon's skill, and when pounding a menu is brought up that offers any monsters in range, as well as an option that allows selecting a square as in *NetHack* if targeting a specific square or an [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") monster. The letters used in the pounding menu can be arranged in either sequential order of target, starting clockwise from N (north), or else apply the same letter to a given directional square (i.e., a is always north, b is north-northeast, etc.) regardless of if it is occupied.

Monsters can pound with the above weapons as well, and some monsters are capable of using certain special attacks at the same range as a polearm.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), the game tries to place the cursor at a reasonable target square initially when pounding, rather than at the character's own location.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3102](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L3102)
